This is a very delicate skirt, and definitely recommended for petite adult woman based on the length of skirt and size of waistband. I love the shiny waistband and the liner beneath the tulle preventing it from being too sheer. The color was a very nice pink, not too bright or light, and I think the photo on Amazon makes it look a bit darker or like there is a darker layer beneath the tulle, which there isn't. I also love that the waistband elastic is wide enough where is doesn't dig into your sides or make you look segmented. My only complaint is that the elastic band inside the shiny fabric is not sewn in or secured, so it is prone to twisting if you are sitting down. It's very easy to twist back into place but can be a nuisance.
Waist band is a bit on the cheaper construction side and a bit smaller, I have a 26 size waist and it pinches. It's not as fluffy and full as in the pictures.

Another thing was my skirt was not to sheer (people complaining about not enough layers) and the slip underneath was just as long as the skirt ( people complaining the under slip was way to short). So I am very happy with my product and it's a steal for the price!

I'll be ordering the other colors whenever I have money! :)

reviewText: I gave this skirt 5 stars because the seller was wonderful to order from, and because the skirt was wonderfully made. It arrived very timely, and the Hee Grand has fantastic customer service. The skirt is a great value, and would be much more expensive elsewhere. I would recommend this skirt to anyone who is looking for this kind of style. It probably needs a slip underneath it, but it has plenty of poof for a tulle skirt.

Packaging was pretty simple, skirt was in a clear plastic bag that was inside a thick gray plastic bag with the shipping labels on the front.  The letter from Hee Grand was very nice and hilarious *with references to Harry Potter*.  The skirt is perfect for what I wanted it for.  I was looking for a long white skirt to fit my 11 year old daughter who is closer to the size of a 9 year old.  This skirt is meant for a petite framed person, my 13 year old could wear it also and it would fit her much like it does the model in the picture *my 13 year old is 5 ft tall and 95 lbs* The waistband is elastic and could easily stretch farther than that...I could probably wear it if I wanted to, though it wouldn't fit nearly as cute as it does on my girls * I'm 5'2 and a size 7 and the skirt would come down to mid shin on me*  I didn't see any issues with the stitching or seams.  The pictures are accurate as to what will be arriving. There are 5 outer layers that are the filmy, soft, netting type material, and underneath those is a thin, satiny slip *which is also the outer material of the elastic waistband*  It's a delicate skirt that I wouldn't suggest for rough wear...but it's adorable and will look amazing in the photo sets I plan on taking of my girls at the beach and dressed up as princesses. All in all, it's exactly as the pictures indicate, it fits my purposes perfectly, the price was outstanding, and it arrived within 2 weeks of ordering even though it wasn't scheduled to arrive until later in June.  Perfect transaction, I look forward to ordering from Hee Grand again.

reviewText: I was so prepared to love this skirt, and while I wasn't expecting perfection, I received something truly ugly. Five layers is actually four, the lining (the layer that makes the skirt wearable in public) barely covered by butt while the sheer level went on to past my knee. It is not even close to being as full as it is in the picture. It bunches at the waist creating bulges at the hips and the illusion of being much heavier than you are. I am 5'5" and 110 pounds and this skirt made me look like I was expecting!! The waist band is a hideous shiny cheap costume material and won't stay flat, the sewing is awful and I could not imagine a way to make it wearable. I am going to give it to Goodwill and maybe some toddler can wear it as a dress-up dress, but even they might be dissatisfied. Unfortunately, it would cost more to ship it back than I paid for it. Steer clear.

I was very excited when ripping the plastic apart to try on this skirt.  It looked so cute in the picture.  However, I think the models must have had their skirts altered because mine was not as puffy.  Essentially, layers of fabric were cut into straight pieces, sewed together at the waistline and held together by a thick waistband.  The look amounts to a lot of bunching at the waist before dropping straight down to the knees.  Think of your mom's skirt from the 1970s or 80s.  Though, if you are very small in the waist, this might work for you.  I tried it with a petticoat underneath but still looked off.  I gave it a 3 instead of a 2 because of the price and the color is very accurate.

reviewText: This skirt is good for the price, but expect to have to sew the elastic down in the waist band or wear a belt over it. The elastic is not anchored and the elastic band with fold in half inside the fabric and cause the waist to poof out in an unflattering shape. That aside, the skirt is lovely like the picture.

Exact number of layers, and fits very comfortably around my waist. I am 5'3 and the skirt falls around mid calf, band sitting above my waist. I could even wear it comfortably as a dress by pulling it up under my armpits if I wanted and add a belt as well. Lovely shade of a light mint green, a little lighter than shown in the picture but pretty close in color.

From reading all the reviews, I guess I had high expectations for this product. I'm content with it, but not 100% happy. Although, considering it was only $15 with shipping, I'd say you get your money's worth.

Pros:
-It came WAY earlier than estimated. It's Aug 4th, and it said it would come between Aug 15th and Sept 5th. I was surprised when I found it in my mailbox today.
-The color is really nice. On my monitor anyway, it's identical to the photo. I got the green one.
-I'm really small, 5' and 96 lbs. It's hard to find clothes that fit me properly, and while the skirt is a little lumpy, a small actually fits me really well! I pulled the band right above my bellybutton, and the skirt came to my ankles.

Cons:
-There were some loose strands of thread coming off the band which still leaves me a little scared to wash it. The bottom looks like it was cut a tad choppy.
-Speaking of washing, there is no care tag, so I'm going to hope it'll survive a cold wash on a delicate cycle, because I don't think I'll be able to easily wash it by hand.
-The band is really loose on the inside and kept folding while I tried it on.
-It's a little lumpy, as I said above, and while it fits my body well, the shape looks a little off, not like the photos. I'm hoping it'll fluff up and look better after I wash it.

Overall, I'd recommend it, because it's a cheap skirt and it's not terrible quality. It just seems really delicate and there were a few minor annoyances but they're not a big deal. Others seem to have had more luck than I did. My biggest concern is how I'm going to wash it, and also what I'm going to wear it with. But I'm sure I can make both work.
summary: Not terrible. You get what you pay for.

The picture caught my eye and I fell in love with the style. My sister really likes these kind of dresses so I got the Black and White one for us to share. But when the skirts arrived, I saw this "Booger" like thingy stuck onto the white skirt so I spotted that right away :/ It was disgusting but maybe if that wasn't there, I would have gave it a star higher.

Is it comfortable?
SOMEWHAT yes but I suggest you get a size higher if you don't want the waist band to be tight. I could barely breathe wearing mine so I had to tug at it or pull it at times I couldn't take the discomfort anymore.

Is the quality great?
I wouldn't say great but its quite decent enough to pass for something enchanted :) The fabric isn't soft. It is actually rough but that is what makes the dress puffy I guess. It is layered but with the skirt I have, they are only two types of layers of fabric which was very disappointing since the product stated "5-Layer".

Overall experience?
I wore this and I love how it looks like. Its just the feel of the discomfort I do not like. People complimented me on how I looked and they said it looks really cute and unique. They asked me where I got it and I told them I ordered them from Amazon.

Would I recommend?
Yes, I do recommend this but make sure you contact the seller if you have any complications and I'm sure they'll clear it out for you :) Or you can ask Amazon for some help :)
summary: You get what you pay for :)

reviewText: This skirt is very pretty but it doesn't really look like the picture.  It has about 2 layers of the voile and then a tiny little stretchy skirt (very see through) underneath.  Also, if you have hips it will likely not go over them.

All in all I love this skirt and will be purchasing in more colors. Shipping was extremely fast, I received my item 2 weeks before estimated delivery date.

reviewText: The fitting of this suit states the UK size 8-10 is the equivalent to the US size 6-8. How disappointed was I to barely get the thing over my knees. It was easily a US size 4 or smaller. The suit was great quality though, with a sturdy zipper and nice feeling material. I'm sure it'd look phenomenal on someone who requested sizing information up front and got one that fit! So sad to have missed out on this one!

I bought this for my wife, and was a little worried about the size since the smallest listed is US 6-8 and my wife is a US size 4, and about 5'4" tall. I contacted the seller and they said it should fit, since it's made to stretch to a size 8, and that if it didn't fit they would let me return it.

When it came, it looked mind blowing just out of the package even before she put it on. She tried it on and wow! It fit like a glove and is very sexy. She said it is very comfortable and it easy to get on and off, also no funky smell or anything out of the packaging, but it's still a good idea to rinse it before wearing. It is a little tight around the neck if zipped up all the way, but even unzipped a little it is amazing on her.

If you want a nice but inexpensive catsuit definitely give this one a try. I know we are not sorry we did.

For the money it's a great value. I've been wearing the socks while running for the past month, they have held up well to both wear and washing - it should be noted I'm deployed to Afghanistan so the socks are under a little "harsher" conditions then may be normally expected.  I bought them expecting to throw them away at the end of my deployment but I don't think I'll need to.

As noted in other reviews, they feel a little thin out of the package, but being a toe sock it works to their advantage if worn with toe shoes where you don't have the space or need for a thick sock.

I experienced none of the manufacturing flaws as noted in some of the other reviews, they are a good quality and a reasonable fit (I wear a size 10.5 mens// 42 in five-fingers).

The only reasons they got four instead of five stars is that the low-rise is almost too low; when wearing toe shoes (vibrams) the cuff of the shoe sits higher than the sock and due to the gap it causes a little rubbing on the ankle from the shoe.  Additionally, the second to last toe (neighbor to the pinky toe) is long, but that may be my feet and not the fault of the sock.

Overall a great value when compared to other toe socks on the market and I would recommend them if you wear socks with toe shoes... they really cut down on the notorious "five fingers of funk" that so many toe shoes are subject to.  All things considered, I would buy them again without hesitation.

This is not a review provided by the seller/manufacturer. I am an actual consumer who purchased this item, which I saw on another website and was hesitant to purchase it there because of the negative reviews I read regarding that website/seller. Therefore, I was happy to see that Amazon carried the product, but was very careful to ensure that the item was being fulfilled by Amazon as opposed to being shipped directly from the seller. I purchased three blouses from this seller: two were fulfilled by Amazon and one from the seller. I have already received the blouses fulfilled by Amazon and they exceeded my expectations (which were quite low after reading other reviews). The blouses look exactly like what I saw online. The fabric was great, and there were no strings hanging off or all over the place. I was really pleased with the quality of the fabric, which I really liked, and they fit perfectly! I am 5'5/127 lbs and I ordered a small and the fit is on point.
As to the blouse that's being fulfilled by the seller, it's set to arrive mid March, which is approximately 1 month after placing the order. In less than a week, I received the blouses fulfilled by Amazon; therefore, I am going to find out if Amazon can carry more of this seller's product.

I had to involve Amazon to negotiate a return. In the end they did what I consider the right thing, but initially they weren't going to take back underwear that I tried on ONCE.
Fit great and stayed down on the thighs. No "ride up". Excellent quality. Only downfall is the price.  Kinda pricey for 1 pair...

I bought these briefs because Howard Stern continues to give them rave reviews on his radio show. He started wearing them a couple of months ago & is always saying how sexy he feels wearing them. I decided to buy one pair to see what the big deal was. I do enjoy the soft, comfortable feeling. But they fit a little big & the price was very high, $31.00 for one pair. If I could have a little tighter fit & maybe find 3 pair for $40.00, I'd buy some more. But they are top quality with a nice unique design that most men will enjoy. If you can afford the price, go for it & I think you will be happy. I am going to look for a multi-pack on sale.

Ok so this is my first Amazon review, but I feel compelled. FANTASTIC product. I normally wear Jockey stretch, which is 90% cotton and 10% spandex, but these are by far the most comfortable pair I have ever worn. I am a daily Howard Stern Listener and he is the one who convinced me to give them a try, thank you Howard!

The only negative is the price. If they introduced a two-pack for $31 MANY more people would purchase and the word would inevitably get out. Thank you Tommy John, thank you Howard Stern, and Baba Booey!

I don't do reviews so this will be brief (no pun) but I really, really do like these. They are very light and almost not there, but still provide support where you need it (you know what I mean). The price is a little bit stiff ($31 a pair!) but I can't argue how comfortable they are. I bought 5 pairs.

I'm not much of a reviewer on Amazon, but I have to say that this is the best underwear I've found. I like boxer briefs. I used to wear Brooks Brothers until they discontinued the kind that I liked and replaced them with a cheaper version that is not the same. I spent the last year trying a lot of different brands from Jockey, Hanes, FOTL, and up to "designer" brands like Andrew Christian, CK, and a few others that weren't any good. These boxer briefs hit all of my needs. Great, substantial elastic waistband; no tag in the back; nice, cool cotton; absolutely no "ride-up" on the legs; no bunching in the crotch; and keeps my bits snug. Did I mention "NO RIDE UP"? They are fantastic and I bought enough for a week. I only hope that they will hold up over time, I'll have to follow up on this review at at later date, but for now I highly recommend these boxer briefs and I may also try their undershirts.

UPDATE:  So, it's one year later. I bought a total of eight of these and wear one pair per day with a backup. They get washed once a week on delicate/cold water, tumble dry low. Seven out of the eight are just like they came out of the box. No see-through, stretched-out parts. As good as new. One of them developed a small hole where the waistband meets the fabric on the side, but it hasn't gotten any bigger and it doesn't affect anything, so it is still in rotation. Again, I would highly recommend these underwear. They cost more, but are great and they last.

I have heard for a while the radio ads on this product. I have always wanted to try them but always figured...next time. The biggest issue that I have with standard Hanes or Fruit of the Loom underwear (and I wear boxer briefs), are that that the crotch area bunches and the cotton becomes worn and loose. You're always having to make an "adjustment". I had asked for the boxer briefs for Christmas but decided I would order them on my own and try them first.
I am glad I did. I really like the look and the soft feel. The fabric is a little lighter than what a compression short for working out would be. In fact it is so lite that it almost feels like there is nothing there. The front crotch area has this nice pocket  with a horizontal flap. It keeps your "stuff" centered and in the right place. These are VERY comfortable.
I was hesitant at ordering such an expensive pair of underwear but it was worth it. I hope I get some more for Christmas. If not I will be ordering again.

reviewText: My husband normally likes a heavier weight cotton fabric, but he gave these a try and loves them. They are a bit pricey though, so these may be his only pair.

I bought these and loved them.  So much so that I bought a whole mess of them. But then they started to develop holes. Not just one pair, but all of them. So I called up the customer service number. After jumping through a whole bunch of hoops, I sent them pictures and all sorts of information. They sent me some replacement pairs. Sure enough, the replacement pairs developed  holes.

Their customer service department will give you a ton of different excuses. But ultimately, at over $30 per pair, I expect better. I expect better customer service. And I expect these to last more than just a couple of months.

I have given up. After searching, I purchased some David Archie's on Amazon. They are made out of the same material but they are a little bit thicker. And so far, they have lasted. And at one third of the price if they develop holes at this point, I just don't care.

Thank you, and Baba Booey to you all.

Everything they say about this product being the best underwear you have ever worn is spot on.  I bought 3 pairs to try them and fell in love.  I eventually ended up buying another dozen pairs, because of how much I loved they way they fit.  After purchasing a total of 15 pairs, I am now down to 2 pairs in less than a year.  They rip and tear very easy.  Small holes eventually become gaping holes, almost like women's stockings.  When I contact their customer service, they asked me questions like do I run in them or workout.  They questioned how I washed them.  They made me take pictures and send them back to them.  After replacing a couple of pairs through their customer service, I finally just gave up and began throwing them away.  I don't know about you, but I can not afford disposable underwear at $30+ a pair.

reviewText: I purchased 5 different brands of long-inseam boxer briefs to experiment. Two by Tommy John (cool cotton and second skin). I can't tell a big difference between the two fabrics. I feel the mediums fit me perfect and were neither too tight or too loose, so the sizing seems right. I can say that the longer inseam is great for people like me with long legs, an active job, and an active lifestyle (bike to work, hit the gym, etc). For the most part they stay down on your legs where they should be (but some of the other brands I tried do better at this). However, given my satisfaction with the other brands I bought and the high price of these, I probably wouldn't purchase them again, unless after 6 months they hold up much better than everything else. I purchased them directly from the Tommy John website. My favorites were the Jockey and Under Armour.

this purse was better than i expected. now i want it in black!!! Definitely buy here again. Thanks for your great product.

I was looking for a medium to large sized bag to take to Europe, use as a day bag/ diaper bag, and hopefully not get caught looking like a tourist with a north face backpack and get pick pocketed. I wanted a bag that could be a backpack if I needed my hands free or a crossbody. I knew they had to be out there somewhere. I finally found it! Super steal of a price, so stylish. I have received many compliments. I use it everyday as my purse, or diaper bag when I tote my daughter with me on errands. Lots of pockets to separate my things from hers. The inside is very roomy and divided. Just awesome and not too bulky.
Only con is that it seems to show some dirt a bit easily, but should be very easy to clean given the material.
I would definitely recommend to a friend.
summary: LOVE this versatile and STYLISH convertible bag. Can use as diaper bag too!

reviewText: Very comfy.

I can NOT get enough of buying items by PattyBoutik!  seriously.  every item I've received have been exactly as I expected and are super comfortable!  This particular item has been very comfortable.  took some adjusting to get the skirt hiked up enough (i'm 5'4").  but once I did I just tied I and left it so I wouldn't have to fiddle with it again.  it's comfortable and flattering and great transition dress from work to play.  and the color is also as depicted.  and nice deep maroon that isn't terribly see through.

I normally wear a 10/12 (34DD) so I thought the large would be fine, it wasn't. It didn't hang at all like the picture shows. Sent it back. An XL would probably be fine, but didn't feel like re-ordering.

I've been looking for the perfect maxi, and I have found it!  I bought the maroon, true to color.  I'm 5'6, 170 lbs, DDD bra size.  I'm curvy and self-conscious about my mid section, and this dress is super flattering.  The draw-string in the middle does the trick.  It's the perfect length, don't have to hem it for my height. The material is thick enough (better than my jersey dresses) and doesn't cling or show every dimple in your butt, and a lightweight racer back sports bra is perfect with it. The material is almost a soft - light weight - knit/sweater material, but will stay cool, not too heavy.  I'll be probably buying this in multiple colors.  I'm so happy with this purchase and it's such a reasonable price.  Say good buy to all your clingy crappy jersey material dresses!

I am normally a small/medium in American sizes. So, after reading the comments, I ordered the large. Turns out the Large is too big. It doesn't look bad but if I lose any weight it will look funny since it is very well shaped.
Regardless, I am very happy with this shirt, it looks great with jeans to look a bit more put together or with trousers for a business casual look. It is super comfy and surprisingly warm.
The stitching looks like it will hold up just fine, no mistakes that I could find. I always check clothes that I order online immediately after I receive them for stitching flaws so I can fix the before it becomes a big problem.
As I said above, this shirt is shaped, so it sort of sticks out on the sides by my hips more than the rest of the shirt because it is shaped so. It's funny looking to me, if I really look at it, but you can't really tell, and I can't wait to purchase another one of these shirts in another color and in my right size because I know the shaping will be super flattering.
I recommend this shirt highly and I will be ordering more!
summary: Size 12/Large in Black. This shirt is true to size. Order your American size!

Sizing is fine (I wear a small), quality is better than expected for the price, no problems with "not" stretching or thin fabric, etc. I usually buy at mid-range retailers like J.Crew and Anthropologie, often to my chagrin because while I love the styling, the quality rarely warrants the prices they charge. Allegra K's got a balance of trendy looks, with fabric and construction quality better than the cheaply made stuff at mass discount retailers, at a reasonable price for what you get. I'd buy from Allegra K again, even with the longer shipping time.

So I ordered this shirt having read the reviews that everyone said to size up/it's way too small, etc etc. I sized up from my normal "xs" to a "small" and I'm a bit upset that I did. It feels exactly like a normal small that is sold here in America (if you compare it to stores such as H&M, forever21, and other young adult stores). I'm not sure what all the fuss is about everything being too small. For me, I'd say order your normal size if you are used to shopping from the stores mentioned above.

I'm going to keep the shirt because it's not so big that it's unwearable. It has that slouchy casual look, which I am okay with, but I'm sure the XS would have done me better.

So as far as picking your size goes - if you are a petite person in the USA (by petite, I mean skinny and short, not just short) then continue to order your normal size. I'm 5'3" and 107 lbs for reference.

Quality is fair enough I'd say. Still a cute shirt.

reviewText: This sweater is so pretty and perfect for winter because its heavy and warm. The only thing i was disappointed with was that the picture makes it look like it has long sleeves but they are actually 3/4. Besides that its great quality, beautiful, cozy, and true to size.

I was very excited about this sweater based off the appearance online.  I ordered large as it was the only size available and crossed my fingers.  I wear a small or medium (4-6) US women's but wanted a slouchy, relaxed look so was OK with a large.  The item shipped same day and arrived more than two weeks before the anticipated shipping window, which was great.  There are care instructions in English which I appreciate from an international product.  The fit of this sweater is just right for me and the look I want except for the sleeves which are clearly for a petite person. reviewText: Like all the other reviews, the sleeves were only 3/4 length. It did have a slight chemical smell, that went away with a wash. Also, when I got it, the front lapels were sown together with a very loose thread, which I carefully removed with no damage to the sweater. It's a little more boxy, and not as long on leg as pictured here. I am about a US size 12-14 and this sweater was definitely bulky, which is OK because that's what I expected. All in all, I'm satisfied for what I paid for it. My one buyer's remorse is as follows: I've never bought clothing from Amazon. I didn't know enough to notice that the sweater was coming from China, until after it shipped. I ordered it on Dec. 21, and it arrived on Jan. 6. That shipping time was reasonable. However, if I'd known it was coming from China beforehand, I would have paid a little extra and bought a similar product, only American made. I'm the daughter of a vet, lol. It matters to me!
summary: not quite like the picture but close enough!

There are a couple things I don't like about the sweater, however. First, the color isn't as pictured. I was really hoping for the beige/black combo, but it's more white or off-white. Secondly, the bottom of the sleeves are not tight enough so I can't pull the sleeves up and have them stay. Lastly, the sweater would be great if it had large pockets.

Other than that, I'm happy with my purchase and look forward to wearing it once it gets cold.

These fit okay, but it seems like it is pretty cheap material. I've seen these on Zulily a lot too, and I have to say I was pretty disappointed  with them. They stained easy, ripped easy and molded pretty bad after only a couple days at the bottom of our laundry basket. I take really good care of my sons clothes and that was the first time that ever happened, I had to throw them away.

My twins both love it and it looks adorable.  The cotton is soft and it keeps them warm.  I should have bought two.

I ordered a whole pile of these pajamas in all different patterns last winter, and I'm back for more this year because they worked out so well. They are comfortable, soft, 100% cotton, and come in patterns that really appeal to toddlers. Which is a plus when you're trying to get them to agree to put their pajamas on! We always have fun letting our daughter choose which ones she's going to wear tonight -- will she be a turtle, or a garbage truck? (We bought some boys' ones for her.)

As everyone else points out, they do run unbelievably small. I had to order 4T for my daughter, who normally wears 2T or 3T in other brands. And the 4T are not even a little bit baggy on her. For your sizing reference, she is 36" tall and 26 lbs, and very skinny.

All in all, I think these are the best PJs out there. But order at least a size up, maybe even two.
summary: Wonderful pajamas, but they run very small

reviewText: very cute... a tiny bit small

reviewText: Very cute pajamas. They fit just as expected :)

It's cute and looks as in the product photo, but the fabric isn't as nice as I'd hoped. The pants in particular are a rough scratchy cotton, though it bothers me more than it bothers my son. The shirt isn't as soft as the one piece toddler pajamas I've bought from Leveret but not quite rough enough to call "scratchy".

In general, the Leveret brand quality is quite variable. I've bought some one piece pajamas that were very soft and sized exactly as expected. I've bought other one piece pajamas that were soft and a full size too large (that is to say, I had two Leveret pajamas which were the same exact length but imprinted with different size labels). And now these, which are sized right but more scratchy than soft. So, it's a gamble.

I'm not a fan of these as the fabric is kind of rough even after washing and the run through the dryer. I guess the quality of the cotton is poor. I bought a couple to try but wouldn't buy more. Unfortunately the ones my girl is growing out of I can't find anywhere. They are from MoshiMoshi on Zulilly but don't seem to be available. Cat&Cow are also good but they don't have 2T or 3T available and I can't find them on Amazon (only on Zulilly). I have 5 pairs and they are super soft and my girl loves them.

I keep buying leveret pajamas because they are great quality, cute, the price is right, and so soft and cuddly. This one is no exception! For sizing, customers can note that my 30 month old daughter (who is 50-60% in all dimensions) has recently moved from the 2 year to the 3 year size. So these run a little small, but at least they are consistent, so once you figure that out, ordering more is no problem.
One of the best things about this brand is that they have unisex designs. She loves the turtle!
They fil well and my 2 year old grand daughter loves them.  Long sleves great for thie time of year.

My twins are 20 months and in the 50-70 percentile and I bought a size 4.... It is somewhat big but since the fabric is stretchable its looks fine. I think it will fit them for a year or so, which is great. So far looks great after 3 or so washes. Will be buying more of these in the future.
I bought this lovely pajamas for my baby girl and the quality was great and the design and finishing also was awesome i will keep buying this brand.
summary: Great Quality and very nice finishing.

reviewText: These are not capri style - they are full length.

The fabric of these is not all that thick and is much more like higher quality opaque tights than cotton blend leggings (which I would have preferred).  However, for the price I do recommend this purchase.  I typically wear 10-12 pants and the L/XL fit exactly as I expected.  I do like the capri length and the spot where the leggings end is snug enough but not at all tight, which is nice.  They don't slide around or ride up.  Someone mentioned these being much nicer than expected and worthy of wearing to the gym...I honestly don't get that from these, even though they do provide good coverage I can't imagine wearing them as "pants" even with a longer tunic style top.  I do that with some leggings which are more cottony and similar to athletic shorts/pants, but these are definitely more like hosiery than pants.  The wide waistband and reinforced crotch bring these up to a 4 star rating from the 3 I probably would have rated them otherwise.  Many reviews mention a terrible chemical smell and I DID notice these had an odd smell right out of the package, but I wore them without washing (the first time) and they were fine, I didn't notice the smell while wearing and I have a pretty sensitive sense of smell.  Once they were washed and dried, it was gone (no Febreze or multiple washes were necessary for me).  All said, I like them and would probably order another color, even though they didn't blow me away either.

These arrived promptly and I put them on as soon as I opened the package.  The size I ordered fit me perfectly and I noticed that they were quite warm.  I sat in bed, got under the bankies, curled up and hardly even noticed I was wearing them.  They are textured and you will notice it when you walk in them, but it's not an unpleasant sensation, just one to think about if you're sensitive to textures, especially if your thighs brush past each other when you walk. I have not yet worn these out in the real world but so far I like them and I would probably order more and in different colors.

I have since worn these all day and I have come to another conclusion.  These fit and wear like tights, only they're footless, obviously.  I am 5'4/5'5 and these are not exactly capri length on me, they are mostly ankle length.  I still like the way they fit and I have worn them all day without any discomfort or irritation.  But they do feel like tights when you put them on and when you wear them.  So if you don't like the way tights feel between the thighs when walking, shorts might be suggested.  Also, wash before wearing.  I have noticed that they have a scent that is not pleasing to the nose.  This is a lesson I have learned the hard way.  I still like these and am changing my response from a 4 to a 5.

reviewText: I just ordered size 6-12 months for my 9 month old. He is scrawny (15th percentile for weight). He was wearing a disposal diaper and they were still so tight I could barely get these zipped on the first wear. They are very tight in the thighs, hips and shoulders. I could barely get both arms in. If he had a cloth diaper, these never would have zipped in a million years. Such a disappointment we won't be able to wear these. Also, the invisible zipper looks super cute, but the unbacked zipper rubs against baby's skin. Looks uncomfortable.  I was expecting the wiener dog on the front chest (not my favorite motif), but I was surprised to see the giant wiener dog plastered across the back, as the back of the pjs weren't pictured. Overall, I am very sad that my splurge overpriced pjs were a bust.

reviewText:
I was hoping for a sexy club dress, which this definitely is NOT.  This is extremely see-thru.  As in, you can see EVERYTHING.  Husband loved it though.

The reason I give it a low rating is that the description is not adequate.  There was no advertised size information (and it is definitely small, NOT one size fits all).  There was no indication that it is NOT appropriate outside the house.  In fact, in the description it is listed as "clubwear", but it is not for anything but strippers or maybe swingers clubs.

I am 5'5" 150lb, 36C and it was fairly tight on me.  Definitely better for smaller figures; I would say if you are usually a size medium, this *might* fit, but just barely.  Since the top is just a halter top that you tie, almost any bosom will fit in it.  The limiting factor is the hip and thigh measurements.  The thong must be an XS or XXS.  I could not get it on at all!

Very short, NOT adjustable sides (they look adjustable, but the strings are sewn in), and very delicate.  When it arrived, it already had a small hole in the seam between the skirt and the top.  And it quickly developed a few other, minor rips, just from putting it on... and taking it off, lol ;)
summary: SEXY LENGERIE - see-thru, small, fragile, NOT CLUBWEAR!

OMG why is it not "socially acceptable" for a man to wear a Skirt!! I had been told in the past that I should try wearing a Kilt, as I enjoy feeling "free" while hiking or working. So after some quick research about fitting I decided I would jump into the Kilt world with the UT Utility Kilt which was priced a lot lower then a lot of the other products out there. Upon its arrival it seems to be very well made, out of a strong canvas material. The snaps are well made, as well as all the hems. As stated by other reviewers measuring is important, as you don't wear a Kilt at your waist, but higher up, so if you are like me, with a bit of a beer belly, you may need the extra couple of inches. It does have large belt loops also, so you can wear it lower and use a belt if you prefer.
I absolutely love wearing it. I feel like I'm getting weird looks at the grocery store or out and about, but in the world we live in now, what should be so weird about a man in a Kilt anyway! I did have 1 time where where a group of teenagers made a comment, which I gladly remarked back that they should try it as its amazing to be free. It really makes me think what a weird society we live in, where a man in a Kilt is strange, but a women can wear a string bikini and its OK! I use it all the time for hiking, which is perfect as you have no chaffing, a nice breeze and no restrictions on movement. I do have to think twice when sitting down, and getting out of the car to prevent a "sneak peek", but that's getting easier. The pockets are deep and have ample room. I would like to have another pocket lined up more with where normal pants pockets are located, but that isn't that big of deal. So all those looking at these reviews you can't go wrong with this product, and I think it is a great introduction before you spend the big bucks on some other name brand...

reviewText:
I've been wearing kilts for nearly twenty years now, of one kind or another.  Sometimes an ancient style kilt for working in my Renaissance Faire booth, then I started with Utilikilts, which I believe are seriously over priced.  When I decided to stop wearing shorts as daily wear, and go entirely with kilts, I bought a couple of UT kilts.  I won't buy any more.  The material is too stiff.  It doesn't hang right.  It doesn't sway with you at all.

EVERY TIME you sit down, when you stand up, the side pleats stick out making it look like you're wearing a hoop skirt or something.  EVERY TIME you stand up, you have to fold in the pleats on the side, because the material is too stiff for them to just fall into place.  The only reason it got two stars instead of one is the side pockets.  They are good sized, and well designed.
summary: I won't be buying another one.

Gave this 3 stars because it looks awesome, is made of nice, heavy black fabric, and the fit is good and versatile (what with the adjustable straps on the side).  The pockets are nice and roomy, too. Carries wallet and cell phone easily with room to spare.  Took two stars off because, like many kilts I've seen reviewed, this one frays at the edges of every cut piece.
One might expect that to happen with a kilt that has gotten a year or so of wear and tear, but this started happening after the first month of owning it, with zero washings.  The buckles are flimsy, as well.  I got this as a birthday present last year.  My birthday is coming round again, and one of the tines on the buckle - the piece that fits through the grommet - somehow bent backward and has to be reshaped every time I want to secure the strap.  Eventually it'll bend right off.  Again, not competing in any highland games, here. Just walking around wearing this kilt causes it to fall apart!
  So, bottom line; it's comfortable, looks great, has roomy pockets; but if you want it to last very long it needs fray-check and the metal will probably need replacing down the road.  Probably also requires additional stitching, so hopefully you have a sewing machine or know a lassie who's clever with the needle & thread.
summary: Looks and feels great, but is not very rugged.

I looked high and low across the internet for a Kilt that could take a beating, as well as for a last minute formal occasion. UTK delivered, seriously I ordered on Friday morning @ 3AM, was delivered Sunday by 10AM. Never seen a turn around like it! Also to the ignorant  people giving bad reviews because of poor fitment.... Follow THE Directions!!!! Mine fits like a Glove! (pant size 36 ordered a 40 after measuring just like they tell you to do, and no issue!) Will buy from again!

I've owned and worn an old UTILIKILT for more than a dozen years, and having lost about 50 lbs recently and about 6 inches off my waist, I decided to get a replacement. That old kilt is made of heavy canvas, colored a dull orange, and it wears like iron, but it doesn't move or flex unless I encounter a very heavy wind to move it. Because it doesn't flex, it looks very 'artificial'. I dyed it dark brown and washed it numerous times to loosen it up without much luck. My UT Kilt arrived and I tried it on immediately. It's half the weight of that old kilt, perfectly stitched fits wonderfully. I intentionally bought mine just a tad loose, and the measurement they sent me was precisely what I needed. DO pay attention to their size chart information. Measure about one inch below your belly button with a cloth measuring tape. Then I recommend that you add TWO INCHES to that measurement. My own waist is 36 inches. If I'd ordered a size 38 UT Kilt, it would have been exactly the right size. However, I most often wear heavier weight shirts, so I added 4 inches to my measurement, instead of just 2 inches. It's still just a tiny bit loose, and I can easily take up the slack with my waist belt,  and with the two waist straps and buckles built into the kilt. If I gain a bit of weight, or add an inch to my waist because of holiday feasting, I'm still going to have a kilt that fits properly. If you get it too small, it will NOT stretch to fit! I'm 6-feet tall; the kilt is 22-inches long from top hem to bottom hem, so if you wear it properly, the bottom hem partially covers your knees. Other kilts sold here on Amazon tend to run 24-inches long or longer, and the shorter 22-inch length was the final factor in my decision to buy from UT KILTS.The belt loops are exceptional, and the UT Kilt folks also carry ab excellent 2 1/4-inch belt that is perfect for the job. However, all the Celtic belt buckles listed here on Amazon are configured for a 1 1/2-inch belt, and there are numerous reviews discussing that mismatch in size. So I opted to continue using the 2-inch heavy leather work belt that I've worn for years with my old kilt. It will work just fine until I can find the right buckle. I'd recommend this UT Kilt to anyone who hasn't tried wearing a kilt before, and I give it TWO ENTHUSIASTIC THUMBS UP for any veteran kilt wearers who are considering a purchase.
summary: UT KILT's Dark Brown UTILITY KILT is a winner!

Because there isn't any elastic, it will fit without give. It wraps around and looks great. I'm glad he wants it because he's got nice legs. I couldn't get away with wearing one.

It arrived quickly and is beautifully made.

When I asked him where he was going to wear it, he replied with a very straight face, "When I'm out hiking of course."
Sizing instructions were not clearly displayed and we ended up with a kilt almost four inches two small. Product was returned for replacement with proper fit.

had to return too small, my fault

I contacted Bruce at UTKilts and he was extremely helpful about exchanging for a larger size. When the new kilt arrived it fit perfectly. It is extremely well-made and, to be blunt, pretty bad-ass!

reviewText:
Somewhat large ,not a magor alteration.
Good quality
Good quality!

Mom got me a similar kilt for my 50th birthday.  I LOVED it so much I found this similar kilt here on Amazon, and I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!

Astoundingly comfortable in all ways.  The ladies will appreciate this next part.  I can bend, lean, stretch, spread feet apart, stand or move any way I want.  And no matter what I do - i'm COVERED!  "My modesty protected," as they say.

As "cool" and well ventilated as the kilt is - I strongly recommend briefs or boxers beneath, lest the boys suffer rash & chaffing.

Another neat thing about the kilt - when using the mens room, I never touch a single snap or buckle.  Whether #1 or #2 - either way - the kilt simply lifts all the way up as needed.  A moment later, my business is complete - i simply drop it back down again.  No muss, no fuss!  :-)

Scottish Engineering at its finest!
love it. As a Kilt person this is # 5  will soon be ordering 6 and 7. I plan to have one in every color. Great kilt great price fast delivery
I followed the measuring guide and it fits just right. I love this kilt. Comfy and cool. Lots of comments from friends. Jealousy....

Glad I can sew. I bought this for my husbands birthday and it did not fit whatsoever.  Way to small.  As a joke I put it on and we laughed that it looked awesome on me, I am a size 10-12 (ordered a 42) and I did need a belt.  I folded it away. Months later I wore it to go out to the bar.  It ripped on the sides, which was surprising as I had to wear a belt with it.  Came home and threw it into the "mending pile"..... I pulled it out of my sewing pile months later to stitch it up and realized the sewing on this kilt is TERRIBLE!!  My kids sew better.  Most of the seams do not come together.  The belt prong holes are not reinforced, just slits in the fabric.  I am going to reinforce it by sewing over the bad seams.  It looks cool and it is fun, but if you want a kilt that is gonna hold together, spend the extra money and buy something worthy.

My only complaint is it doesn't have chrome snaps, buckles, and grommets. It has the antique brass ones and this required me to get an antique brass buckle for my belt. Otherwise? This thing rocks! I get compliments and crazy stares all the time when I have it on. Gotta love the curious people... LOL

Single-line stitching in a lot of places tell me it's going to fall apart after a few washes. It looks good at a glance, and if you don't intend to wear it often then it may work well for you, but despite being made with decent material and an aesthetic design there is a major lack of craftsmanship here. The fabric is of medium weight, suitable if you don't run or jump, just make sure to wear a sporran so the wind doesn't flip your kilt.
Furthermore, it is suggested to order 2 sizes larger than your pant size, but unless you've got a well-invested beer gut the kilt will be too big. I wear an awkward 35. That means 34's don't quite fit right and 36's are a bit loose. I ordered a 40 figuring I could just cinch it up a little, but even after adjusting the built-in belts to the tightest level couldn't keep the kilt around my waist. I mean I like easy access, but this is ridiculous. Even using a belt of my own crunches up the kilt in a very obvious way.
TL;DR: If you're slim, athletic, or even mildly fit, don't order two sizes up. 5/5 design, 2/5 craftsmanship

reviewText: I purchased these for my hubby. He tried to insist I buy the same size as his jeans, but I would not. Too many people mentioned in their reviews to NOT buy your jean size! They had to have good reasons for stating this, so I insisted I measure hubby's waist. He was not happy about it, but he finally agreed. So I measured around his waist at the belly button (I kind of pulled the tape measure tight as he sucked in his gut). That number was the size I ordered and they fit him perfectly!!!! So do NOT order your jean size, MEASURE YOUR WAIST and order that size. The quality is excellent and they were very comfortable (according to hubby). He wants to wear them everywhere now. I realize many say if you were underwear underneath, then it's just a skirt, but I still made him wear boxers when he wore them around our friends (I know our friends would try to grab a glance to determine if he's wearing them traditionally or not).
summary: Fit perfectly; ordered WAIST size, not jean size

reviewText: Bought for my boyfriend and he adores the comfortable fit and ease of wearing.

When I bought this kilt 2 years ago, I liked it.  At the same time I also bought a $205.00 kilt from Utilikilts.  Obviously I didn't expect the same quality and attention to detail, but I thought the UT kilt was dollar for dollar a better value.  I don't love the positioning of the pockets on this one, they are kind of half-way between on the side, and behind, like it was a compromise between the two.

That said, I've had them both for 2 years, I have worn each maybe 10 or 12 times total, albeit mostly out in the desert for Burning Man, which is pretty harsh, but I started to wear it around town on hot days here in L.A. CA recently.  Basically the two of them have been folded in a drawer for nine or ten months, and I just pulled them out.  The Utilikilt looks near new.  The UT Kilt has multiple seams coming apart, one pocket is completely open on one side, and several of the pleats and seams are just not sewed shut any more.  Worse, the fabric is faded! Like, really blotchy faded!  Not from over washing, because where it's pleated or the material overlaps when you wear it, it isn't faded.  I think the dye they used just fades in the sun, and unevenly at that.

There has to be a happy medium between "Falls apart in occasional moderate use" and "Expensive as all get-out", so I'm trying some of the other brands on Amazon.  The Damn Near Kilt 'Em I just bought has a really nice feel to the material, and lots of pockets!  It's too big, so I'm returning it for the next smaller size, and I wish they sold it by the inch instead of Small, Medium, Large etc., but I have high hopes.

For what it is, it's excellent. However, this is NOT a kilt I'd be seen wearing around town (maybe the black one though). It is excellent as a beater to work around your home or property, sturdy material (I'd almost argue too sturdy) and the stitching is superb. I ordered a 42 to be safe (my waist measurement was 40) and it's still a bit snug, but comfortable. The fasteners are well done, as well as the buckles, they're not chinsy or thin.

My gripes:
1. The box it arrived in was too small. The kilt was folded over so many times to fit in the box that when it came out I couldn't even try it on. Had to iron it before even making an attempt.

2. The pleating is incorrect. To the average eye nothing appears wrong, but to people who wear and know kilts, it is wrong. The pleats are shallow, which is good for being active in heat, but the way they are done means the whole thing doesn't have room to flow (This was expected for the price).

THE BIGGEST PROBLEM... additionally, the pleats. They are made symmetrically, so the right side follows conventions but the left side is reversed, they meet at the middle of your rear and this completely throws off the way it flows around you. It's incorrect. This is the main reason I will not be wearing this out in public. It's fine as comfort wear, which which was the intention I had when buying it, no biggie. This is a pattern that I'd expect more on a military-style utility kilt, if ever there truly were such a thing.

I'd definitely recommend this again as an entry-level kilt, the quality is better than elsewhere.
This kilt is nicer then I thought for just getting into wearing of kilts. Yes there is a great deal room, not pants that are constricting, free flowing.

reviewText: Fits great, looks great, love it.

Still looks great on - and of course, a belt is always worn anyway! First wear was to a Halloween party, and it looked wonderful!  Nice quality stitching and the pleats are very crisp!  Looking forward to trying it out at the Renaissance Festival this year.

Also, when originally ordered, I ordered the wrong size and this seller was VERY helpful and quick in sending the new size.  Still turned out a bit large, but fits well enough to wear comfortably anyway.
Sizing is a bit off but looks good either way

I agonized over which kilt to buy my husband, a first-time kilt-wearer, for Christmas. This turned out to be the perfect choice. The fit is perfectly. It reaches the perfect length. The pockets are really handy; my husband has commented that it's great to have pockets outside of the kilt because, unlike those sewn into pants, they don't cause the garment to bind. He especially likes the open pockets sewn onto the outside of the main pockets, since he directs a choir and can put his pitch pipe into one those pockets for easy access. He opened this Christmas morning and immediately wore it to church to direct the choir! He got mixed reactions; the men (rather conservative) didn't seem to know what to make of it, but the first comment from a woman was "great legs!" I think he looks great in it and it IS very manly!!

He has wanted a kilt for a long time, but the traditional multiple-pleat kilts are prohibitively expensive, he couldn't find the exact tartan, etc. Then, on an episode of "Wipeout," he saw a contestant wearing a kilt that looked like leather. Turned out to be a Utility Kilt, something we'd never heard of. I knew I'd have to get him one, and it won't be his last! He loves this kilt and plans to get more. It arrived super-fast, too.
summary: Perfect fit, perfect look. Great kilt!

This is a well made product, with great attention to detail, just remember to pay attention to the details when you order it.
The standard utility has an improved model without the straps on the side but has more snaps on front. Sleeker look but slightly less traditional.  Watch the fitting video. I say again, save yourself time and effort by doing it right the first time. WATCH THE FITTING VIDEO and follow his directions. He's not kidding when he says the jean size will not be the same. Kilts ride differently. He's recently added a style with a comfort waist, check that out if you think it might work better. I ordered larger so it could ride lower. Note the length of the standard kilt is 22" for you taller folks.(I doubt he just picked the length at random) He does offer custom kilts made to length if you think it will make that much difference but 22" will usually put it right at the knee. The cargo pockets at the sides are not obtrusive and well thought. One can easily slip a cell phone, wallet and clip a pocket knife. Other stacked pockets have covered tops. Fast personable service and a pleasure to do business with. A good value for the quality. A great first kilt. Wear them everyday.

Absolutely Fabulous! Serious piece of working Kilt!  Be prepared to learn ironing though, but what's a little time for something that looks great and wears well!  Seriously, for the non-traditionalists out there, Kilts are a gift from the Gods.  You can dress it up a zillion ways, or buy a bunch of sleeveless long tail t-shirts from Duluth and have a blast!  Long tails keep the back from wedging up your arse while moving from a sitting to a standing position.  All my other kilts I had to stitch in a shield of polyester to allow the wool to not be pinched up by sweaty butt-cheeks... If you wear a kilt, you understand, if you don't own one yet, remember my warning.

reviewText: Arrived on time and fits perfectly! Very high quality material. Should last a lifetime.

I measured myself for wear as I would wear my jeans. This is fine and dandy if you don't have a belly (beer or otherwise). Something to take into consideration with the UT Kilts found here -  the waist band is thicker than that of your pants. That affects the fit. So, be sure that where you measure for fit is at least two to three inches in area up and down, otherwise you will have trouble with the fit.

I had to do a replacement to get the proper size. I contacted UT Kilts and got great assistance, was pointed to the proper online page for returns and exchanges where I filled out the form and then sent it back. Total turn around was about seven days, three days each way for shipping.

The product is well made, looks great, and fits very well, when properly sized. I'll be purchasing more in the future. I'm very happy with UT Kilts, their product and the support I received.
summary: Great Kilt, and not just for the price.

reviewText: This is a good quality sturdy kilt.  I read the reviews and like many ordered a size larger.  Do not! I bought my kilt a little over a month ago, and I wear it currently about 3-4 times a week.  So, it works obviously.  Personally, I wear this while going out dancing at the Country Bar in town, and at bare minimum it gets people talking.  After ripping three pairs of jeans while dancing, I decided to try this out.  I would be hard pressed to go back to wearing pants for dancing.  Be aware, EVERYONE will ask you what is under your kilt (I field this questions about 30 times a day) so if you are going to wear underwear, make it long.  The pockets work great for the most part, just watch where they are when doing things like getting into a car, the pocket can tear off at the thread.  Also, good point, the pocket will tear off at the thread, so you can just hit it with a needle and thread, or with a sewing machine, and be back up to snuff in two shakes of a lambs tail.
I personally bought it 2 inches too large on purpose, because I can just slip it right off if necessary and it isn't uncomfortable to sinch up.  Overall, if you are wondering whether you can wear one or not, or whether it is for you or not, as long as cost isn't an issue for you, go for it.  The freedom you feel, and the strength you get will make all the skirt talk worth it.

As for the kilt itself - Well constructed, looks great, and the color is awesome (I bought the Olive Green). It's a great item - I'll buy more.

I've been wearing kilts on and off since I was "a wee bairn," as it were, and I've wanted a utility-style kilt since I first saw one a few years ago.  I finally bit the bullet, and I'm glad I did.

So what makes this kilt so great?

First, the "build" quality.  UT Kilts makes a fine product.  This thing looks like it's going to be with me for a good long time.  The fabric is heavy-duty and the stitching is neat and solid.

Second, the pockets.  I love the pockets.  I didn't think I'd get much use out of the little slit-style exterior pockets, but they sit at th perfect height for me to stick my hands in them, and they do a perfectly fine job holding a tube of lip balm.  I suppose I could put change in there if I kept it in a little coin purse or something; instead, along with the lip balm (which pretty much lives there), I just stick anything in the slit pockets that just needs a home for a few minutes.

As for the large pockets, they're perfect.  They hold my epic phone (Samsung Galaxy Note) and my wallet, no problem.  That's about all I carry, but the phone is so big that there's just basically no getting it into a trouser pocket (cargo pants excepted, but I tend not to wear those).  I bought this kilt in part as a way to add more pockets to my cycling kit without actually adding full-on pants.  I haven't worn it on the bike yet, but I suspect it will do just fine in that regard.

One more note: don't be afraid to order right on size.  I ordered a few inches larger, because I was paranoid, and I shouldn't have.  It doesn't make enough of a difference that I feel like I should return this kilt (it doesn't fall off or anything), but a snugger fit would be a little better.
This kilt is great, and heavy duty.  One thing to remember is that the sizing is different than here in the States, took a little research but the one I ordered came in right the first time.
Good quality item, wears like a charm, get's lots of compliments. Just be sure you order your size according to the UT Kilt website and you'll be golden.

I bought this as a surprise for my husband, because he'd always wanted a Utilikilt.  I read the reviews and was very nervous about ordering the correct size.  My husband normally wears a 34-36 pants, but his belly measures 38" around just under the belly button.  I read the advice from the other reviews, and I ordered a size 40 to be safe.  I'm very glad I ordered a little bigger.  It is a little loose when he stands up, but when he sits it is snug around his tummy.  He says he would be very uncomfortable with a smaller size.  To help with the looseness when he stands, we got a 2" wide belt. and he's very happy with it!  The fabric is heavy and the length is perfect for my 5'8" husband.

reviewText: I have worn this kilt several times and every time I have I get so many compliments. I love it.

The previous reviews were very correct regarding the sizing. BUY bigger - I usually wear between 32-34 jeans and ordered a 40 just in case. Not tight but it did leave some breathing room.

They insist you measure your waist before ordering.  Good move, although mine is just a bit snug.  I hope it doesn't shrink.  I'll follow directions, and if it does, I'll amend this review.  I got the black one - perfect length, denim-like material, and an outer pocket on either side of the apron.  The two pockets may be enough for some men, but I'm a pack rat and still need my sporran. They are about 6"X6", a snap flap on top, and each has a little three-inch sleeve on the bottom portion with no closure, great for a credit card, driver's license, if you want to chance losing it.  Better for clipping a pen or two.

If you've ever worn a kilt before, this review isn't for you.  This is my first kilt, so I'm not a kilt expert.

1.  Go measure the thickest part of your waist RIGHT NOW.  Don't think you know what it is.  And don't think that there is any give in this kilt, either.  There isn't.

2.  Undo the entire kilt before you try to put it on.  Don't try to slide it on like a tube.

3.  The flat part goes in the front.  The belt loops go in the back.  There aren't any in the front.  You could wear a belt with this, but it would have to be a wide stiff one to look halfway decent.

4.  The buttons go in the front.  There are two buckles on the side to help adjust the fit.

5.  The pocket flaps on the side can be unbuttoned to store keys and a wallet.  There are no pockets for you to stow your hands, if you're used to standing around with your hands in your pockets.

6.  The material is very heavy duty, almost like an Army tent, but not as rough.  This thing will probably last forever.

7.  It seems like a good cross between a work outfit, like for hiking, and a formal outfit, like for a ceremony.  I bought a Scotland t-shirt to wear with this, and the t-shirt seems a bit casual and light-duty for it (pajama-like?).  I also think I need to get some hiking boots with wool socks to wear with this.

8.  If you want to return it, the sellers are very nice and accommodating.  But you will also be out 20 bucks.

Wearing a kilt for the first time is strange.  You initially feel like you are wearing a dress.  But when you take it off and put on shorts, you will feel even weirder, like you are wearing some skimpy outfit.  So you'll go and put the kilt back on. Now it feels cool.  Functional.  Manly, because you are ready for anything: formals, chopping wood, laying around, flashing women who ask the obvious.  You then cut off the tag and smile, because you now own a kilt, and you can feel your beard growing even thicker.

reviewText: I really like this neat Chauffeur's Taxi Limo Driver Hat. It is very authentic looking and is made very sturdy. A few things to know when ordering it, it may not be shaped in a perfect circle (apparently my box had something heavy set on it in transit and it was smushed in) I warmed it up with a blow dryer and quickly got it back into the proper shape. This hat is definitely for an adult or someone with a bigger head and it does state that in the description of the hat. I am only 5' tall and it is a bit loose, but with a little bit of tweaking I have it sitting comfortably on my head, I added some stuffing inside the hat and it made it fit my tiny head. The band is a very nice simulated patent leather and it has two really shiny brass buttons, one on each side of the band. I received mine free for an honest review, but for the list price this is a really great buy. I can even see this being used as a conductor's hat, old school porters in hotels/airports etc. had hats like this. I can see many more uses than the ones that are listed.

I received the chauffeur taxi/limo driver hat in exchange for my honest review. This hat is really cute but I feel that it fits a little large. I try to keep my daughter's dress up/costume bin growing to keep her mind growing. This is a nice little addition. The fact that my daughter's head is the same size as mine helps. I would recommend this for adults unless like my child your child's head has a larger circumference. This made for a nice little addition. The hat is well made. it feels very sturdy and looks nice. The brim is a shiny plasticy material and the top of the hat is a light thin material. The stitching is well done and feels pretty sturdy. I like this hat and I may use it for Halloween next year.
summary: This is a nice little addition

reviewText: I bought these back in the spring and love them! I used one when I pierced my nose and I have had no issues whatsoever. I mainly wear a dark blue stud out of these. I ordered more over the holidays since I love them so much! I'm happy with these. There's only one problem with them, the screw part us hard to insert. I remedied that with a pair of jewelry pliers and straightened it a bit. It stays in with no issues. I'm very sensitive to some types of metal but with these I haven't had any irritation at all!! They are subtle yet flashy. If that makes any sense. Lol.

The quality isn't top notch, but the screw doesn't show which it oftentimes does with other brands. I don't have to constantly push my nose ring back into my nose.

reviewText:
Not a bad product at all as far as I can tell! I think the people who are saying that it doesn't fit in their piercing are trying to change jewelry too soon. If I had tried this one ~6-9 months after getting my piercing, I would say it didn't fit because it hurt too much to put in. Once the piercing is fully healed, you should be able to get most studs in no problem.

reviewText:
I'm 5' 3" and 145lbs and got a 3(M) - they fit well enough that I still wear them, but next time I'll get a 4 in hopes of more length in the legs. I have a 28" inseam, and this is the first time I've ever felt the legs on a pair of stockings were too short!

That said, I will be reordering when I inevitably wear these to death. They're durable, silky, and breathable. There is no control top (Halleluia! I hate sausage casings), and they don't bag or sag. Other backseam styles I've tried have been flimsy and prone to runs (I suppose they're viewed as 'novelty' hose), but these are a good investment made to be comfortable and last. So far I've made it through a workweek with not so much as a scuff or pull, even where my shoe edge rubs.
summary: Size up, but definitely get them

I am 5'1" and 125 pounds with chest, waist, and hip measurements  at about 36", 29", 38".  I was expecting "sexy", but this dress looked way too "hoochie".  I'm petite and it barely covered my rear.  I don't know how anyone taller can wear this. The shoulders/ sleeves didn't stick up for me like what other reviewers described.  I wish this dress was a bit longer and made with a better material. This waterproof necklace offers a pretty simple design that is durable and practical. The necklace uses a magnetic clasp and has five small silver-colored rings that are meant to provide strength to the user. The silicone rubber is a bit thick, so wearing this takes a bit getting used to if you normally wear thinner necklaces. It would be simple to add a charm or pendant to this necklace, adding to its practicality. These are available in multiple colors, so you can find one that would match any wardrobe.
summary: Simple, practical silicone rubber magnetic sport necklace

reviewText:
I suffered from chronic lower back pain due to a herniated disc.  I have tried many things to help with the healing process, and was a little hesitant about the necklace reducing my lower back pain.  After about a week or so of wearing the necklace, the pain in my lower back has reduced, and the pain continues to lessen.  The necklace also looks like jewelry if you place the metal in the front.  I wear it 24/7.
As a side note, when I first opened the package and wore the necklace there was a rubbing alcohol smell.  I simply washed the necklace in soap and the smell went away.  I am also allergic to certain metals, but not with the metal on this necklace.
summary: Works, don't know how, but it does!

At first I was so skeptic about this health benefits you get from anionic negative ions, but I thought of giving it a  try. I'll never know unless I try. I've been having pains in my left hand for months after the my IV was removed when I got discharged from the hospital so this is a nice opportunity to know if it really works. When I received this product I was impressed because I did not expect that it will look this nice. It makes a stylish accessory. I also like its shade of pink. The silver accents made it attractive too. For almost three days that I wore it on my left hand, I observed that the pain became less. When I press the painful part of my hand before, I can't tolerate the pain but after wearing this as bracelet, the pain wasn't that much anymore. I honestly don't have idea how that happened but thanks to this titanium magnetic necklace. It was worth the try. I would recommend this to anyone who's in pain and for athletic people. I received this product at a discounted price for my honest and unbiased review.

I have to admit something...I'm still not sure exactly what this necklace is 'supposed' to do for me, but I love it! I know that it's supposed to help improve energy, but products like this tend to work a bit differently with my body. Energy-boosting products have a tendency to provide mood-improving benefits for me, which is an awesome, yet surprising benefit! I haven't noticed a significant increase in energy...in fact, it's finals week, so I'm sleeping a lot less than I should be, so I'm always sleepy, but I'm not experiencing the drastic mood changes that generally come with tiredness for me, which is really nice!
I love how easy this necklace is to take off or put on, thanks to the super-simple magnetic clasp that I find myself playing with all the time. I do wish the clasp wasn't so heavy though, as it makes it more likely to end up at the front of my neck, instead of in back where I want it to be...but I do like that I can play with the little metal pieces in the front, putting them together, or spacing them out however I want to. It makes the necklace a bit more versatile, and easy to wear with a lot of different outfits! This necklace is easily suitable for wearing with a t-shirt, but can also be dressed up to suit just about anything that i want to wear. I'm definitely a fan, and have been wearing this every single day since I received it.
I received this necklace for the purpose of my review, but my opinions are 100% my own, and based on MY personal use. I was not told what to say, only asked to give an honest review based on my own experience with the product.
summary: This is a fun, sporty necklace that can easily be dressed up or down!

reviewText: I purchased this necklace with the hopes that the negative ions would help negate some of the radiation from electronic devices. I am not sure if this necklace has improved my balance, but I have noticed less upper back pain since I started wearing it. If nothing else, it does give me peace of mind that I am reducing my radiation exposure levels.

Let me start by saying that in regards to any health benefits derived from wearing magnetic necklaces (pain relief, increased energy, etc) that provide anionic negative ions - I can't really make any claims one way or another. That said as far as these types of necklaces go this is a good one - very durable, comfortable to wear for days on end and very easy to remove on and off with its solid, magnetic clasp that locks in place with a satisfying 'click.'

At 18 inches in length it's not quite a choker necklace and I like the look of the extra inch or so that drops below my neckline. The cord is smooth and thick silicone (5mm diameter) that is not too thin, not too chunky but has a nice rugged look to it. The magnetized titanium is bright and shiny at all times and looks good in contrast to the dark color of the black corded version I have. Great design and great feel all around (product sample provided for review).

I received this necklace to give an honest review. It is well constructed, waterproof, durable, lightweight and fits really well. One thing I like about it is the magnetic clasp that keeps it securely fastened and is very easy to get it fastened without the hassle of a clasp to open and shut. I think anyone who purchases this will be very satisfied with this necklace. I give it a 5 Star rating!!!

The scar tissue and lack of flexibility has given me almost constant pain no matter how much I've stretched applied heat to it. I'm not sure that the magnet is actually healing anything, but it is certainly giving me some relief, and it seems to improve everyday. I am happy I decided to try it myself and ignore both the debunking and success claims to draw my own conclusions. I can't promise it will work for you, but it certainly has helped me.

I ordered this headband to wear with a leopard print dress to a drag event. I am a real girl, but I wanted to look cute and interesting. I ordered two headbands in case one was broken after reading the reviews. I figured that if they were both fine, I could give one as a gift. When they arrived they were neatly packaged and arrived at least two weeks before the estimated arrival. One of them did have a pearl loose as soon as I opened the package, but was otherwise perfect. The second one had several pearls loose, and one of the little cups the pearls get glued to was loose. I am a jewelry crafter as a hobby so I always have a tube of E6000 glue handy. This glue works wonders with things like this that are traditionally hard to glue. I just reglued all the pearls that had come loose. I also checked the fastness of all the pearls that weren't loose already. On the one headband with only one loose pearl, the others were all glued securely. In the end, both are perfectly wearable. I wore the one with only one loose pearl to my event and had a blast. It held up fine and I will be able to wear it on many more occasions as well as being able to give the second one as a gift. It's really cute. I would recommend if this is your kind of accessory.
summary: Very cute and good for the price

reviewText:
I thought this was going to be stunning ,Honestly,  i gave it a chance figuring an accessory is an easy way and a cute way to dress up something just as a simple touch,, when I first opened it, I fought with it to stay together, it was 2 dollars, and I waited over a month for it to show up, so i figured it'd put some time and effort into it. And of course right away i thought to myself, You get what you pay for! It took me over 20 minutes to get it to stay together by pressing the connectors together better than it was created, (maybe mine was just a dud, I'm going to email the company, and update)

 And honestly its not that cute on, it doesn't sparkle as much as the pictures, if you're looking for something classy don't pick this, if you're looking for something for your young daughter to play with, go this route because you can throw it in the trash and not feel bad about it or turn it into an art project and make it into something better! I threw it in a drawer and didn't think twice about it after I got it, when initially I was so excited about it! I give it 3 stars because it looks a lot better than something that came out of a penny machine, I do give it that, it isn't the cheap rhinestones you get from the dollar store, its the better stones similar to  quality ones you'd find at the Claries in the malls.  When I put it on after I got the thing to stay together, mind you I was so sad from waiting so long for it, but two, from the connections falling apart from the linkings (not major, normal with cheap jewelry, simple fix squeezing/bending the connectors) I put it on in my bathroom, and the thing was tight, I'm a petite girl, and I have a very small head and can normally wear kids headbands and accessories and hats without a problem, so it was a bit uncomfortable since the top part is metal, I figure i'll have to stretch the elastic out on it before I wear it.
summary: Meh, Nothing to be excited about, great for 2 bucks!

reviewText: For the money - it's really quite nice! You have to be careful to twist the little flowers so they're all facing "up" and don't get tangled in your hair. It's really high quality for how little it costs.

I ordered two of these so I could mimic the style shown in the picture. One of them came broken. I suspect it was packaged broken because one link had fallen off, but there was only one circle connector in the bag instead of the two needed to put it back on. It should be an easy fix, but it shouldn't have to be fixed. Also, it twists easily, so I'm not sure that it will hold up well.

The reason I still decided to give it a 3 is because although I was underwhelmed when I took it out of the bag, once I put it in my hair, I LOVED it. It is very elegant with just enough sparkle to catch the eye. It also manages to be exactly the right size for my head. I'm able to do some really lovely headband styles I've been wanting to do, but other bands are too big or too small to work well. Obviously, that's a pretty personal thing, but the other nice thing is that if it's too big for your head, it's easy to remove a link.

If it holds up, this will definitely be one of my favorites.

Hopefully they will replace the broken one. I'll update here if they make that hard, otherwise you can assume they were on top of it. Still very frustrating given how long it has to take to ship in the first place.

Super cute when I got it in the little plastic baggy!  All I did was rip open the plastic bag like I would open anything else, pulled the headband out of the plastic bag and it broke.  One of the little metal rings holding the flowery pieces together flew off and I was unable to find it.  I was disappointed to see this happen before I even got to hold it outside of the packaging.  I don't think this product would hold with everyday wear.
