reviewText:
I have been purchasing iplay reusable swim diapers for about 6 years.  It all started with my oldest when I was tired of buying disposable diapers for swimming every day.  Yes, I said every day.  We used to live in Hawaii and we would swim every day.  My son (and now 2yo daughter) love the water so much they ask to go swimming on a daily basis.  Understandably, this can get expensive when you are swimming in the pool or ocean 4-5 times a week for 52 weeks a year.  I am not kidding.  Kids love the water.  Maybe they take after their surfing mamma, but hey I am not going to deny them I love it as well.

Anyway fast forward to the girl, we recently moved to WA, with the ocean at sight this kid thinks she can swim in the Puget Sound with water temps in the 50's, uh no.  But I dragged out her overly used old pair that was waaay overused and drooped in the butt, so it always looked like she pooped and I had to break down and buy her another pair even though she is 90% potty trained.  Alas, I digress.  Amazon to the rescue!  After a full 14 day adventure driving from WA to RI and staying in hotels only with indoor pools, hey they have to get the sillies out somehow, i am pleased to say they still are the greatest purchase!

I never seemed to have any of the problems with the fit issue.  I just go by what iplay has listed on weight and order accordingly without any problems.  So (fingers crossed) I have not encountered a poopy pants with my daughter in these, but with my son yes, oh yes!  And before you say oh dang so gross, the snaps on the side are a real lifesaver.  Back in the day I did not know about this amazing feature and did not purchase ones with snaps.  I would have to slide the poopy pants down and they would get all over! Him, his legs, the towel, oh my!  But these ones with the snaps are amazing!  And by the second kid one usually can scope out those tell tale signs that a turd is about to make an appearance...lol you all know what I am talking about!
Love this swim diaper. Easier to get on and off than the disposable ones. Only issue is I got a 24mo size for my 11mo old. Hoping shell be able to wear it for a few months.
summary: Great swim diaper. Seemed to run small for us.

reviewText: Super cute, easy to get on and off
Great

My daughter is a small 11 month old (usually wears 9 month size clothing) and I had to order the 18 month i play because the 12 month set I got felt way too tight. We're very happy now though. They are super secure though and great for her swim lessons!

I ordered the 4 for my almost 2 year old based on reviews saying to order up and Im glad I did. Fits her perfectly! She is definitely not petite so if you have a petite toddler then maybe don't go up 2 sizes!
summary: Adorable. Order size or two up!

reviewText: Maybe you baby has skinny legs but the leg holes are as tight as they should be to contain a number 2. I like the buttons for when Im taking the bottoms off of her but don't find it useful when I put the bottoms on. I love the design and pattern options they have though, super cute.

If you have a rather petite child, order true to size, otherwise size up. We ordered the 24 Mo, tried it on my daughter who is 25 months old, 24 lbs but has chunky thighs and tummy: way too tight for her, I could barely close the snaps. I would go 3T or even 4T fo rher on this brand? Found the snaps quite difficult to open; open carefully so as not to stress the fabric. This may be a little difficult if you are working with the snaps on a squirmy or uncooperative kid. The 24 MO diaper fit my niece who is 22 months old and quite petite/spindly 18 lbs, fit was perfect on her (snug and easier on/off).

In my opinion, the iPlay prints are very cute and like the bum ruffle for the girls, elastic around leg holes and waits is of good quality and make a really leak proof fit.

However, in the event of an accident/poop, I would not want to deal with pulling one of these off especially when tight and wet and clingy, even if they do snap open on one side, what a mess??? Two-sided opening, not pull-up or one-sided, is pretty essential in my experience.
summary: fit was perfect on her (snug and easier on/off)

reviewText: I really like this swim diaper. My little one is a year old and weighs about 19 lbs but the waste band is so tight it leaves a mark that lasts long after the diaper is removed. Still because there are 4 snaps I figured out I can leave the top snap open to make the waste bigger but the diaper is still secure enough to stay on. So it works out fine. The quality of the diaper is great so I would not hesitate to buy this brand again however next time I will order a size up.

I believe her, because we stopped using our old 18-24 month pull-on style when she started getting basically rug burn from removing the wet swim diaper!  So, we're returning it & basically hoping that she won't poop in the pool this summer!  (She's very close to potty trained and tells us when she needs to poop.)

reviewText: I am really satisfied with my purchase of the iPlay Baby Girls' Ruffle Snap Reusable Absorbent Swim Diaper. I found them so great; I ordered them twice, as my little one grew. My daughter used both size: 6-12 months & 12-18 months. These swim diapers feature easy-lock side snaps (one side only); a snug fit which helps contain solid matter and is approved for public pools. TMI time, my little one had a few #2 incidents and each time there were no leaks, we were able to quickly get her to a change room  clean her and quickly rinse the swim diaper; she was back in the water in no time!. My daughter is small for her age, so I would imagine they may run small because I ordered her age appropriate size and they were tight; however for their purpose, I think tight is good. These are for babies and young children who normally need diapers or tend to have accidents in the water. I find these swim diapers to be economical because they are reusable and very easy to wash even on the spot. Ive only needed two diapers as my child grew and no other back up diaper is necessary. Another cool perk is that they are UPF 50+, which is excellent sun protection. The design is super cute too, so you could just purchase a swim top and your little one is ready for the pool or beach. Now, if you are like me and cant control yourself from buying cute swim suits, these swim diapers fit right under and you can barely tell they are on. I have provided photos from both my purchases to give you a better idea.
summary: So great; I ordered them twice!

reviewText:
These swim trunks are great, but make sure you look at the size chart. It gives a breakdown by weight. My little guy is just over 1 and weighs just over 21 lbs. I ordered him an XL, or 24 months and they fit him great with some room for growth. In regular clothes, he only wears 12-18 month sizes.
Below is the i play size chart:

i play Swimwear Size  US Clothing Size  Weight
(in lbs)
Preemie  Birth  4-6 lbs
Newborn  3 Months  6-10 lbs
Small  6 Months  10-18 lbs
Medium  12 Months  18-22 lbs
Large  18 Months  22-25 lbs
X-Large  24 Months  25-30 lbs
3T  3 Years  30-37 lbs

I ordered 3T for my 20 M.O. son (taller but average weight for his age) looking forward. It turned out that the trunk fits OK right now. Well, it's a little long, but the bands around the thigh are already tight. The band around belly also fits well if I pull it up to cover belly button (although it may not stay there).
summary: band around thigh is on tight side

reviewText: It says 12 months but it turns out to be 6-12 months which makes it smallish thna expected and incorrectly reported size. if your child is almost 12 months, it is going to be tight on him, now or fairly soon.

These suits last forever and the colors stay bright. Best of all, when combined with a disposable swim diaper (a double diaper is required by our pool) - they do an amazing job of keeping in the occasional #2 accident. Our baby and toddler are in the water almost every day and we are absolutely hooked in i play brand.
Perfect swim shorts for around the backyard love the built in swim diaper. They fit true to size and look adorable for my little swimmer.

Loved this orca design and bright colors on this swim shorts with built in swim diaper, however, I had to return it since the fit was a whole size too small.  Could not find this design in a larger size so that was disappointing.  I recommend these, but order a whole size up.  The 3T fit like a 2T even when other 3Ts can be a little too big on him.
summary: Cute and age appropriate design, small fit

reviewText: Theses swim trunks are exactly what I was looking for. They seem to be comfortable and have a think inner lining to prevent an accident in the pool. My son loves the fire truck design.
These are So cute! The trunks fit well and my son loves them. Easier than buying swim diapers and cuter

Took the suggestions of others and ordered a SIZE UP for my son.  He is 10months old and I purchased the 24months size for him as he is probably around 24lbs. He typically wears size 18 months in most clothes.  This fit perfectly.  I liked the idea of trying trunks that had the built in swim diaper.  Was curious to see if it would 'hold' as well as swim diapers.  Not sure how I feel about it yet.  I could tell that my son did 'pee' in his trunks while in the pool, because they got VERY puffy.  haha.  The only problem is that they have no way of 'absorbing' wetness from pee like disposable swim diapers, so unfortunately I'm afraid it may have leaked into the pool??
summary: Son wore these in the pool the other day - worked good

reviewText: As an infant swimming instructor I always recommend the iplay brand.  Cute patterns.  Lasting performance and side snap make a great product even better.
summary: Best choice for infant/toddler swim use!

reviewText: The quality seem to be pretty good, but never got to actually try it out on the beach/pool because they were too small. My son is only 4.5months and they were just right. My suggestion go a size up (unless your baby/child) is more on the skinny side. Otherwise its a great buy.
summary: The quality seem to be pretty good, but never got to actually try it ...

reviewText: I love it

While these are the most well known/common swim diaper brand, I was not impressed with the design.  There are 3 snaps on one side so you can't really adjust the size of the diaper.  I know most babies could benefit from some personalized adjustment as they all come in such different size/shapes.  The design was cute and as pictured but I returned this in favor of a different brand with many more snaps for custom sizing.
summary: You have to get the perfect fit in order to use these

reviewText: Bought this as a gift for my friend's son.  They fit him perfectly and looked so cute.  The color is great and seems to hold up well.

This print is cute but item runs small - not sure if it's suppose to be tight since it's a swim item. I put this over a disposable swim diaper as well (but it's tight around his thighs even before I did this).

I also paid 13-14 for it at the time and saw the same brand at my local Target (different pattern than what I bought) for 9.99!

Love this.  Love the print, the buttons and does its job.  My daughter had a nasty poop while swimming last week and the diaper contained most of it!

This is SO tiny! My daughter is only 17 pounds and she is already too big for this.
